text: The Department of Psychology at City, University of London are looking for smokers to take part in research on cigarette cravings. The research would involve 1 session of around 30 minutes in which you answer some questions about your smoking history, habits and cravings as well as complete some short thought exercises. You will receive ¬£10 for your participation. Please email Sharon.Noonan-Gunning.1@city.ac.uk if interested. http://ow.ly/d/86nK
linkedText: The Department of Psychology at City, University of London are looking for smokers to take part in research on cigarette cravings. The research would involve 1 session of around 30 minutes in which you answer some questions about your smoking history, habits and cravings as well as complete some short thought exercises. You will receive ¬£10 for your participation. Please email Sharon.Noonan-Gunning.1@city.ac.uk if interested. http://ow.ly/d/86nK

text:
Congratulations to our first cohort of MSc in Global Finance students graduating today!

We believe in making learning accessible whilst mirroring real-life corporate situations, across the globe. text:
Have you visited our Exhibition The Story of City : life, learning and legacy? Today we share an online exclusive.

The proposed Northampton Institute Key Plan of Site Shewing Positions of Station Points for Perspectives. 4th August 1892.

This plan shows the awkward triangular site that the building would occupy.¬†The site was donated by William Compton, the fourth Marquis of Northampton¬†and¬†his son, William, Earl Compton.¬†An article written at the time in The Builder notes ‚ÄúThe site was a difficult one to treat, owing to its shape‚Ä¶though apart from this it is a fine site, with good frontages in each direction.‚Äù The blue area shows vacant land, the pink area was yet to be acquired, and on the yellow area was tenanted at the start of the¬†building process.

text: To celebrate 125 years of City, we present our first exhibition, The Story of City: Life, learning and legacy. On display are documents and objects which tell a story about the origins of City, then known as the Northampton Institute. You can view the exhibition in University Building Pavilion until the end of the year.

You can view the exhibition in University Building Pavilion until the end of the year.

Come along to this interactive workshop hosted by Blind in Business on Monday 4th February.

It will be centred around graduate employment after university and include topics such as disability disclosure, reasonable adjustments (at the interview/assessment stage and when in work), Access to Work, and specific organisations and internships which are exclusively available for visually impaired students. 

Book your place at this event now: http://ow.ly/IEg930ndgzs

text:
With 2019 being City's 125th anniversary, throughout the year we will be sharing 125 moments captured in City's history with photos from our archive.

Our first image is one of the earliest captured back in 1898 of the Swimming pool in College Building. This renovated area now serves as a study area for PhD students.

We would love to see your images of life at the university throughout the years, use the hashtag #City125 to share them with us! üì∑

#photography #archive #history #london #anniversary #city125 #swimmingpool #building

fullName: City, University of London - Careers Service
text:
Have you started thinking about your future career? 

The Universum Career Test will give you an edge in the job search process and provide feedback on career-focused questions such as:

Which career profile are you? (There are seven career profiles, this test will determine which profile fits you best)
What soft skills are companies looking for?
What employers suit me?
How can I improve my CV?
Join the 1 million + students who take our test every year by clicking here https://buff.ly/2OA79nY  

This survey is brought to you by City, University of London in partnership with Universum. 

This test is available for a limited time only. Your answers and results are confidential and always kept anonymous. If you have any inquiries, feedback or concerns you are welcome to contact us at info.universum@career-test.com.

text:
***LOOKING TO TRY A NEW SPORT IN 2019?***

Our Learn to Fence programme is back! 

Starting on 6th February 2019,this popular course is open to all City, University of London students wishing to give the sport a go. Learn the rules and basic skills with our qualified coach - All equipment is provided so you won't have to pay out for kit - just wear comfortable clothing and be willing to commit for the 10 weeks*

We anticipate this course filling up fast, therefore places will be offered on a first come, first served basis. The course costs ¬£15 and is available to book NOW at CitySport 

Students will need to register their details on the CitySport website prior to coming in or phoning to book and pay. 

*Students will need to commit to the whole programme and cannot join after the course has commenced

fullName: City, University of London - Careers Service
text:
15 minute quiz to:
-   Discover your career profile (There are seven career profiles, which one are you?)
-   Find out how your career expectations match up to other students.
-   See a list of employers that fit your career profile that you might not have considered. 
-   Get a free CV check and become even more competitive in your job search.
 
You can participate by clicking here https://buff.ly/2OA79nY  
 
This survey is brought to you by City, University of London in partnership with Universum. 

This test is available for a limited time only. Your answers and results are confidential and always kept anonymous. If you have any inquiries, feedback or concerns you are welcome to contact us at info.universum@career-test.com.
